segment.source: Configure an MDM provider (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure an MDM provider (Windows 10)

segment.source: For companies or organizations using mobile device management (MDM) tools, those tools can synchronize with Windows Store for Business inventory to manage apps with offline licenses.
segment.target: For companies or organizations using mobile device management (MDM) tools, those tools can synchronize with Windows Store for Business inventory to manage apps with offline licenses.

segment.source: Configure an MDM provider
segment.target: Configure an MDM provider

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: For companies or organizations using mobile device management (MDM) tools, those tools can synchronize with Windows Store for Business inventory to manage apps with offline licenses.
segment.target: For companies or organizations using mobile device management (MDM) tools, those tools can synchronize with Windows Store for Business inventory to manage apps with offline licenses.

segment.source: Store for Business management tool services work with your third-party management tool to manage content.
segment.target: Store for Business management tool services work with your third-party management tool to manage content.

segment.source: Your management tool needs to be installed and configured with Azure AD, in the same directory that you are using for Store for Business.
segment.target: Your management tool needs to be installed and configured with Azure AD, in the same directory that you are using for Store for Business.

segment.source: Once that's done, you can configure it to work with Store for Business
segment.target: Once that's done, you can configure it to work with Store for Business

segment.source: To configure a management tool in Azure AD
segment.target: To configure a management tool in Azure AD

segment.source: Sign in to the Azure Portal as an Administrator.
segment.target: Sign in to the Azure Portal as an Administrator.

segment.source: Click Active Directory, and then choose your directory.
segment.target: Click Active Directory, and then choose your directory.

segment.source: Click Applications, find the application, and add it to your directory.
segment.target: Click Applications, find the application, and add it to your directory.

segment.source: After your management tool is added to your Azure AD directory, you can configure it to work with Store for Business.
segment.target: After your management tool is added to your Azure AD directory, you can configure it to work with Store for Business.

segment.source: To configure a management tool in Store for Business
segment.target: To configure a management tool in Store for Business

segment.source: Log in to Store for Business.
segment.target: Log in to Store for Business.

segment.source: Click Settings, and then choose Management tool.
segment.target: Click Settings, and then choose Management tool.

segment.source: You'll see a list of available MDM tools.
segment.target: You'll see a list of available MDM tools.

segment.source: Choose the MDM tool you want to synchronize with Store for Business, and then click Activate.
segment.target: Choose the MDM tool you want to synchronize with Store for Business, and then click Activate.

segment.source: Your MDM tool is ready to use with Store for Business.
segment.target: Your MDM tool is ready to use with Store for Business.

segment.source: Consult docs for your management tool to learn how to distribute apps from your synchronized inventory.
segment.target: Consult docs for your management tool to learn how to distribute apps from your synchronized inventory.

segment.source: See Manage apps you purchased from Windows Store for Business with Microsoft InTune to learn how to configure synchroniztion and deploy apps.
segment.target: See Manage apps you purchased from Windows Store for Business with Microsoft InTune to learn how to configure synchroniztion and deploy apps.
